JUDGES: George Nicolaou;Ineta Ziemele;Krzysztof Wojtyczek;Ledi Bianku;Päivi Hirvelä;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr M. GPE , a lawyer practising in PERSON .
CARDINAL . DATE the applicant was the head of the Prime Minister ’s political cabinet ( PERSON Prezesa PERSON ) .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE a prominent film producer PERSON , in exchange for a bribe , offered to TIME the editor of GPE ’s largest newspaper -Gazeta Wyborcza- to arrange for a change in a draft law aimed at limiting the print media ’s influence on radio and television . He claimed to be acting on behalf of what he called a “ group in power ” which wanted to remain anonymous . In DATE PERSON printed the partial record of A.M. ’s conversation with Mr GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the PERSON ( the lower house of the NORP parliament ) created a special parliamentary committee to conduct an investigation into the circumstances of the affair and the group in power .
Simultaneously , a separate criminal investigation was conducted against Mr GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON committee officially terminated the parliamentary investigation . By a majority vote it adopted a final report which came to the conclusion that Mr PERSON had been acting on his own . Subsequently , the PERSON had to decide whether to accept the committee ’s official final report or CARDINAL of the various minority reports as the outcome of the investigation . Unexpectedly , on DATE it voted to accept the minority report that most radically departed from the majority report and named the applicant as a member of the “ group in power ” and one of the masterminds behind GPE ’s mission ( together with CARDINAL other persons : the former prime minister , deputy minister of culture , head of the NORP public television and a high - ranking politician ) . The authors of the report considered that the applicant had committed the criminal offences of bribery and false testimony .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested ORG ( Prokurator Rejonowy ) to institute an investigation in order to establish whether he had committed the offences listed in the parliamentary committee ’s report .
CARDINAL . The applicant ’s case was transferred to ORG ) and subsequently to ORG , where it was joined to an investigation which had already been pending ( concerning the “ group in power ” ) .
CARDINAL . The applicant was heard by the prosecutor on DATE and DATE . It appears that he was not officially charged with a criminal offence .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s representative asked about progress in his case . In reply he was informed that it was not possible to envisage the date of termination of the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s representative again asked ORG about the progress in the investigation . He confirmed that he was aware of the fact that the investigation concerned several persons and many issues .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that since the alleged bribery scandal concerned CARDINAL other persons listed in the PERSON ’s report of DATE , it was impossible to terminate the proceedings only with respect to the applicant .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE in view of the organisational changes in the prosecution authorities , the investigation was transferred to the newly created State Prosecution ( ORG ) and its FAC office .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discontinued the criminal proceedings partly on the ground that no offences had been committed and partly because some of the offences were time - barred . The Prosecutor obtained evidence from numerous witnesses including many politicians and obtained voluminous documentary evidence .
CARDINAL . The applicant could not appeal against the decision to discontinue the proceedings , since he was not listed as CARDINAL of the culprits in the final decision .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial and enforcement proceedings , in particular the applicable provisions of LAW , are stated in the ORG ’s decisions in the cases of ORG v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( dec . ) , § § DATE , ORG , and NORP v. GPE , no . CARDINAL ( dec . ) , ORG CARDINALVIII , and in its the judgment in the case of PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE .
